sense.name: formation
sense.commentary: ESTABLISHMENT[+event] constitution, organization, organisation - the act of forming something
sense.examples: The establishment of a PTA group last year was surprisingly easy. It was the establishment of his reputation. He still remembers the establishment of the club back in 1940.

sense.name: an organization
sense.commentary: institution - an organization founded an united for a specific purpose
sense.examples: They turned their small company into a large establishment.

sense.name: administration
sense.commentary: governance, governing body, brass, organization, organisation - the persons (or committees or departments etc.) who make up a body for the purpose of administering something
sense.examples: He claims that the present establishment is corrupt. They governance of an establishment is responsible for its members. He quickly became recognized as a member of the establishment.

sense.name: building and equipment
sense.commentary: a public or private structure (business or governmental or educational) including buildings and equipment for business or residence
sense.examples: This establishment was built 50 years ago.

sense.name: validation
sense.commentary: ESTABLISHMENT[+event] the cognitive process of establishing a valid proof
sense.examples: Any information in a paper needs to proper establishment from facts.

sense.name: ecology: move-in
sense.commentary: ESTABLISHMENT[+event] the process by which a plant or animal becomes established in a new habitat
sense.examples: We're studying the establishment of sagebrush on mined lands.
